headline: Chicken Fiesta Salad
description: Salad greens, onions and tomatoes are topped with Mexican flavored black beans, corn, and grilled chicken breasts. This is an attractive and zesty all in one dish.

video.description: Serve this up for a light dinner when you’re craving something a little spicy but not heavy!
video.name: Chicken Fiesta Salad

name: Chicken Fiesta Salad
recipeIngredient: 1 (1.27 ounce) packet dry fajita seasoning, divided
1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained

recipeInstructions.text: Rub chicken evenly with 1/2 the fajita seasoning. Heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat, and cook the chicken 8 minutes on each side, or until juices run clear; set aside.
In a large saucepan, mix beans, corn, salsa and other 1/2 of fajita seasoning. Heat over medium heat until warm.
Prepare the salad by tossing the greens, onion and tomato. Top salad with chicken and dress with the bean and corn mixture.

review.reviewBody: This is a fantastic salad exactly as is!
Easy. Yummy. Dinner salad. I sautéed a little red pepper with the corn and beans. And used a packet of fajita seasoning and wished I used a jarred version instead.

Made it as the recipe stated and it was delicious and super easy/quick to make for a weekday dinner. I did not add cheese or tortilla chips and suggested in the description but next time I will try it.
My kids LOVED this, can't wait to gave it again. I added capsicum to the salsa, cucumber to the salad and avocado on top. Chicken was so tender. So easy to throw together for a busy mid-week dinner.
Absolutely delicious and so easy to make
Made it as recipe states and it was very good. I added guacamole, sour cream, and cheese as toppings. For leftovers, I served over lime rice with cilantro and had it like a burrito bowl. Very good!

My family and I absolutely loved this! I mixed the corn, blackbeans, and added cilantro, avocado and juice from 2 limes in a bowl and spooned that over the salad mixture. It was very good and kept well since it wasn't all mixed together.
My family loved this! We didn't have beans, so I used 1/2 can of refried beans, It was great! Made the dish more of a Mexi-Mash than just a salad. I also mixed shredded cheese in with the greens.

I chopped a bell pepper and added it to the corn bean salsa mix. Then served the salad with avocado and tortilla strips, sour cream optional. Also fried my spanish rice in the fajita seasoned oil left after cooking the chicken. My husband asked me to keep this recipe!
So simple yet so tasty! Will definitely keep this recipe
this is a wonderful receipe. one of the reviews suggested topping with some jalapeno ranch dressing, which was a fantastic idea.
I used tacobseasoning because it's all I had, added cheese and sour cream.

Needs a sauce or dressing like chipotle. Marinating chicken before hand would be great. 
It took longer to cook on the stove top than the recipe called for.
I used the same amount of corn as beans.

It thought this was delicious! I added a little more salsa than called for but I love tomatoes. I loved that I didn’t have to use dressing because it replaces the need. I will definitely make this again.
Very tasty. Yes, I will make it again.

This recipe is incredible! While making it, I thought "this is not going to be good--it's too simple!" I'm so glad I was wrong. The corn/salsa/chicken mix flavor perfectly complements the salad greens. 

We barbecued the chicken first, but otherwise made this as written. This one's going to become a regular for us! We loved it!
A little different than my own "taco salad", but viva la difference! big hit at my house!
This was pretty good, I squeezed some lime juice on top for some extra flavor. Next time I might try adding a little sour cream and avocado.
Husband loved this. I liked it . Very easy to make. I did put Mexican cheese on top. T

Delicious! Easy to throw together and very tasty. This is a great weeknight meal and good way to use up extra chicken- I used leftover chicken that we had grilled over the weekend. This is delicious as written with warm toppings but I liked the leftovers with cold toppings as it was very refreshing. This would be wonderful with avocado or any other Mexican toppings, even a sprinkling of Spanish rice!
I only used 1/2 the fajita mix total. So yummy! I added avocado, a little sour cream, and queso fresco.
Exceptionally delicious.
I made it with caribou instead of chicken. Very good the bean and corn mix really makes the difference.
Make as is. It’s absolutely delicious.
With bits of pineapple, mango, bell peppers & jalapeno this would be an outstanding salad
With bits of pineapple, mango, bell peppers & jalapeno this would be an outstanding salad
This is very yummy. Instead of taking the time to cook chicken I used pre-frilled chicken from the store. Worked out great and super fast.
This was excellent, although I went to 3 supermarkets and couldn't find Mexican corn, I just used frozen. Also used sliced Baked Split Chicken Breast (recipe here). Will make again for sure!
Nothing special here. It was just ok. I followed the recipe exactly. Ho hum.

This was pretty delicious. I went by the recipe and it made a nice lunch. I did mix up a combo of ranch mix, sour cream, and fresh cilantro to top it with. I also used green onions. I think this would be great in a tortilla bowl. Next time I won't heat up the salsa, bean, and corn mixture, and will omit the extra fajita seasoning. I think the salsa mixture would taste better left cold/room temp, when topping over the salad greens. Thanks for the recipe!
Perfect summer salad. I followed the recipe pretty closely. I used fresh corn instead of canned, and added avocado, a few tortilla chip crumbles, and a good squeeze of lime. Really easy and filling.

We really enjoyed this, I was actually surprised the my fiance went for seconds. The only change I made was to add red pepper halfway through the heating of the bean and corn mixture. Next time I will added shredded tortilla chips for crunch.
Just a ok salad. Mixed chicken beans & corn together will have them in burrito's tonight may add cheese and raw onions to it.
This was delicious! I added guacamole and Cholula Hot Sauce to the recipe and it made it extra special with balanced textures and flavors.. Will be making this many more times here on out.
Absolutely delicious. I cut the two breast halves in half, chopped up my own fresh salad greens, and used grape tomatoes in lieu of cutting a tomato into wedges. It made four large portions.
delicious and extremely tasty!! adding this to my all time favorites list for sure!!
very delicious, healthy, loved it! Perfect for a low-carb diet.
Very good and easy to make. My hubby asks me to make it all the time!!
After cooking chicken, I put in the oven for 15 min at 350 degrees. It made chicken taste better.

This is just a glorified taco salad. I think it would be better just using taco seasoning instead of fajita, our preference. Also no need to make preparing in 2 pans. For presentation layering is nice, but again not necessary.

Really salty. After making it, I reread the positive reviews and nearly everyone made their own fajita seasoning. Maybe that would be helpful. Also hot food on salad made everything wilt. Won't make again
This came out PHENOMENAL!
This is very easy and quick for a handy meal. I used salsa verde since that's what I had on hand. I love that it's so low fat.
Loved this salad! So easy to make, so tasty and so filling. Didn't change a thing. Love it

This was a big hit at our house. I wanted to use up some chicken that was already cooked, so I skipped the first step and just diced the chicken and tossed it with the fajita seasoning, then warmed it up in the microwave for a couple of minutes. Otherwise I followed the recipe to the letter. Next time I will add some shredded cheese and chopped avocado. Yum!

We liked this very much. It was one of those nights when everyone was eating at a different time and this worked perfectly. Made the fajita seasoning from this site. There was more than enough for our 4 so I didn't add the corn, but I will do that next time.
This is really good and easy!

How could anyone not like this salad ? You don't have to follow to a "t" just add or leave out what you like or dislike. We top with crushed tortilla chips and cheese, also avocado if there is a ripe one on hand. You can mix ranch dressing with salsa to pour over the top. Very versatile recipe, thank you for sharing.

My husband and I loved it. I must admit I used what I had in my kitchen so it is a little different but a wonderful filling salad that we eat as a main meal. I always have a large container of taco seasoning so I used that instead of the fajita seasoning and I just used a regular can of corn vs mexican corn and romain lettuce vs a bag of mixed greens. I did topped the salad with some crushed Doritos because we like a little crunch in our salads and I had a some Wishbone Chipotle Ranch dressing that I also added. It was wonderful!
made this a few times and it is a big hit!
I followed the recipe as written. While it is tasty dish the chicken could use more fajita seasoning. An excellent dinner main course.
Very good salad. My family loved it, especially my husband.
This is a great twist from taco salad. There is spice but not too much heat. It is quick and simple to make. My family loves this meal!

Really great salad, and I typically don't like salads. I added a bit of frank's hot sauce to the salsa, which helped make it a bit spicier. In the future, I might only top the salsa on the salad I'm going to eat, instead of the entire dish. The salad gets a little wilty if it's all mixed together and stored. Still tastes great though.
loved it!
This was good but way to much onion. I would suggest adding only half the amount of onion called for.

I made this recipe and surprisingly my husband really enjoyed it. I only made one additional and that was cooking a cup of instant white rice on the side to add to the salad. By adding the rice it made the salad more fulfilling. I also sprinkled shredded cheese on top. This is a salad I will make again and recommend.

Awesome, and as others have indicated, a great salad to jump off on to create your own blend! I stirred the beans, corn and salsa right into the skillet with the chicken, and threw the onions into that mixture too. Added some grated marble cheese to the skillet as well which made the mixture all gooey and yummy! Grabbed some tortilla chips I had, crumbled them on top of the greens & tomatoes before layering on the chicken mixture. Added ranch dressing like others. Deeeeelishhhh!
Wow, fantastic!! Use Herdez salsa if you can swing it!!!

WOW! So much flavor. Both my husband and I couldn't get over how good this was. Only thing I changed was I rubbed chicken breasts with taco seasoning (I didn't have fajita seasoning) wrapped in foil and baked at 375 for 30 min (thin cut chicken breasts). I didn't add any seasoning to the bean/corn/salsa mixture. Served with a little cheddar cheese and a little ranch dressing. So good. Can't wait for the leftovers for lunch. If you plan for left overs do not put the bean/corn mixture on until you are ready to serve again.
I cooked the onions. We threw it all together in a wrap for dinner and it was yummy!!
Great recipe. Kent really liked it. I made it "as is" although I could have added sour cream on top.

Made this recently and it was delicious. I used a minimal amount of fajita sauce because I did not find the dry fajita seasoning, but it still tasted pretty good. I also added about less than a handful of Tri-Color Tortilla Strips when I was about to eat it.
This was a delicious salad, especially considering it only took about 25 minutes, start to finish! The hardest thing you have to do is turn the chicken occasionally. My family loved it.
I made this last night for dinner. Instead of mixing it with greens, I served it over a bed of Mexican rice. Delicious!!!
Awesome!! Love this great recipe. My husband found it!! Now its one of our favorite!!

I sauteed orange and yellow bell pepper with the onion, then added the corn, beans, salsa and seasoning. I even used chicken breasts that were already cooked. Just sliced them thin and warmed in a pan with fajita season and olive oil. I served this dish with sour cream.
This was surprisingly good! I wasn't going to even try it because I thought it would be too much like a taco salad, but we (my husband and I) really liked it! Will definitely make again :-)
I used low salt black bean and corn. Have to watch my sodium intake. I also added balsamic vinegar. My husband ate it as is and liked it.
I added diced Romano tomatoes, instead of salsa. Blackened corn. Squeeze fresh lime over salad. Yum!
I will definitely make again! Topped with cilantro for that GREAT fresh taste. Will substitute lettuce with rice next time. Really loved this.

This was so good that I decided to leave my first review about anything. It is just as filling as it is tasty! I did add a few nacho cheese chips (oops, they just fell on there) because I like a litte crunch with my salads.
Thank you for this, now a summer staple at home.
this is sooo good! we put avocado ranch dressing on the side and it complimented it well. will nake again. everyone loved it and my 10 year old asked for seconds.
Good! I made my own fajita seasoning out of spices that I had in the kitchen. I also used a bit more salsa than called for, which I thought was better.
Did not make changes, was easy and delicious.
I topped my salad off with Doritos spicy chips to add more flavour.
Great combination of flavors. I will be making this again in the very near future.

I boiled my chicken breasts with a homemade fajita seasoning, then shredded them. I did heat up the corn and bean mixture. My husband didn't like it on the lettuce, but other than that, it was a big hit at home. Others commented on how good it smelled when my husband took the leftovers to work...
An incredible salad. Better than any taco salad I've made.
Made it as per recipe, but I doubled the fajita seasonings for the chicken. It was excellent, both the child and hubby loved it,a win in the books!

This was delicious and my whole family enjoyed it! Based on what we have in the house, I used flat chicken breasts seasoned with taco seasoning, sliced in large slivers. We tossed in cherry tomatoes (helps contain the tomatoes for those tomato haters), and instead of adding salsa, we put it on the side, in addition to a choice of chipotle-mango-yogurt dressing (on the side of course). We also skipped the onions this time, and had feta as an option for the grown-ups to toss in. That cheese made me so happy. Yum. Everyone loved this salad, which is such a joy.
This is missing cilantro which it needs desperately.
I added cilantro, but otherwise made it as written. Will make it again.
I've been making this for a few months, exactly as written and it is delish.
We have this every couple of weeks. It's easy to make, but most of all DELICIUOS.

I really liked this recipe. It will soon become a staple in my house. I added some cheese because everything is better with cheese :-). My grocery store was out of mexican corn so I substituted a can of corn and jalapeno.
Good, healthy, but the onion was too strong.
Yummy as written!!!

My husband I eat this on a daily basis. It's really simple to make and great for leftovers! I usually make it the bean/corn/salsa mixture and cook the chicken on the weekends and then we just reheat and throw it on the top of a salad for the whole week.

If you plan to keep it this way, you can make your chicken even more flavorful by storing it with the beans and corn mixture.

A little bit of spicy ranch on top of the salad really does the trick!
Its quick and simple to make and pretty flavorful.
Amazing!!! I use the fajita seasoning recipe from this site and this recipe turns out awesome!
Loved it!
This was so good. Had great flavor and was very filling. Made Texas Toast on the side. Love trying new recipes and this is a keeper!
It was great I loved it I put collard turnip and mustard greens and I forgot I put the salsa in till the last minute but it ended up great I'd say 4 and 1/2 stars

I liked this ok. The fakey flavor of the mexicorn threw it off a little for me, and it really needed something creamy to blend it together. My second try I mixed sour cream and salsa together as the dressing, but it was still missing something. I also think my choice of greens was unfortunate for this recipe. I used a mixed green blend with a lot of peppery arugula, and I think it overpowered everything else. I would add cheese and some crumbled tortilla chips. I might try this again with some milder greens and without the canned mexicorn.
so good. We love salad and it is a great change from the normal. I had a lot of the bean/corn/salsa mix left. I made nachos with it. SOOOOO good
6/14: very good. i used taco seasoning and grilled it. one ear of fresh corn for each person went into the pot with the black beans and salsa. yum
Pretty good put ranch dressing on top!!
